Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2013 06:20AM Evans1128 wrote: I have been wondering the same thing with my chemo Carboplatin/Gemzar. The first time I had chemo, AC, my hair fell out within three weeks. I was completely bald. I then switched to Cytoxan and Taxotere and my hair did not start growing in until that was complete. However it has been 7 weeks on the new regimen and I hardly have thinning. I actually just took a chance and got extensions today. Hoping I won't regret it and they end up on my pillow. Sorry I know this does not answer your question but here's to keeping your hair and not having that added stress. God bless
Posts.Title: Day 22 on Taxol and I still have hair. Lots of it. Anko66 texasrose361

Posts.Title: How Many Are We? DivineMrsM kt1966

Posts.Content: Evans1128 wrote: I actually posted this is someone's topic but felt bad and thought I would start a new one. Thank you ladies in advance I am so glad I started reading this thread. I am having so much anxiety. For those of you who read my threads in the past few weeks you know that I have been through the ringer with pancreatitis, gallbladder stones and sludge and elevated liver functions. Dr started me on Xeloda while in the hospital and this was supposes to be my off week but once my levels kept getting higher I pretty much refused to sit for a whole week. Dr says it's to early to see if Xeloda is taking effect and a plus is that it is one one of those meds that can be given with elevated liver functions. I just feel like my body is going through so much. I have been a little jaundice in the eyes. Dr says it's elevated functions. I am praying to God that the Xeloda starts to take effect and turn things around. I will win this fight!!!! Posts.Title: Chemo or Clinical trial???? Don't know what to do Evans1128 Fitztwins

Posts.Content: Evans1128 wrote: So after weeks of sitting around worried after scan showed spots in lungs and liver, I finally saw my Dr at Dana Farber yesterday. There is a clinical trial that I qualify for now. Name is Cabozantinib. I guess it's a targeted therapy for triple negative. She gave me the option of that which would be monitored in Boston or Xeloda and another chemo which can be monitored by my Onc here at home. I am really scared first of all that this beast may have gotten worse while waiting. Dr in Boston says that the targeted therapy has been effective for many women however what I have researched says it works very well for the bones but no mention about the liver or lungs. I have to say I am more worried about those areas than the bone met. I did sign the consent for the trial and I am due back in Boston next week for repeat bone and CT, and blood work to start the trial. Now I am really scared to have these scans done again. I don't know what to do. They claim they are not focused on the results but that scans have to be updated to qualify for the trial. Urghh. Does not help ease my mind at all. What if things are worse????? What would you ladies do? Chemo or the trial? Dr didn't really suggest one over the other, but did say that I had plenty of chemo options for the future. I am sick of being a sitting duck and just want to see the best possible results. Thank you ladies. I will win this fight!!!! Dx 1/24/2012, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIIC, Grade 3, 3/8 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Chemotherapy 2/1/2012 Adriamycin (doxorubicin), Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Surgery 6/27/2012 Lymph node removal: Right, Sentinel; Mastectomy: Right Radiation Therapy 8/9/2012 Breast, Lymph nodes Chemotherapy Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Gemzar (gemcitabine) Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Feb 14, 2013 12:20AM Evans1128 wrote: I am also struggling with my stage IV diagnosis and have chose to not share with others. Only my boyfriend and mother know about the bone mets however I have not shared the latest developments with them. The reason being that I know them both well enough to know that I would end up supporting them through it which I feel like many people with illnesses have to do with their loved ones. My son is only 11 months and sometimes I don't know of that is better or worse. My boss knows that the cancer is advanced however she does not know specifics. I feel like some of the other women who have posted, I don't want to be on a "death watch". My family is large and had a hard time just with my initial diagnosis. We have lost several people to other cancers and one to complications from BC so I am sure everyone has done their homework. When asked about my health and recent scans I simply say that I am "hanging in there" which is true. Just taking it one day at a time. I do realize that everyone's situation is different and you want to make sure that your son has supports especially since he has voiced a concern. I think you can have a conversation with him and find out what would make him more comfortable then try and come up with a solution that would work for you both. It is a very personal issue and I understand not wanting everyone to know. Sorry that you have to be here in the first place. ((((((hugs)))))

Posts.Content: Evans1128 wrote: So, I am finally scheduled to start a clinical trial tomorrow at DF. I had a CT last week and will have a bone scan tomorrow just to have updated scans for the trial. Although Onc and research team says the scans are only for trial participation and that they are not concerned with the results, I still fear that things have gotten worse in the past month since last scans. Last CT showed two small nodules on lungs and liver. At the time I had no symptoms however in the past three weeks I have lost my appetite and have pain in my back on the right side as well as what feels like cramping in the pelvis. I also get an annoying pain in my right ribs near the liver. It does not really hurt just more annoying and last maybe 5 seconds. I am really scared that they will mention something tomorrow and even more afraid to ask. I have also lost a couple pounds in the past few weeks. What symptoms if any did you all have with liver mets? Really curious to know. I know it won't change anything and I guess if it's that bad off they will tell me just thought I would put it out there. Thank you all in advance!!!! I will win this fight!!!! Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2013 12:07AM Evans1128 wrote: I had hot spots show up on a Pet scan. My Onc strongly believes it is mets however she did ask me at first if there was anyway I could of injured myself to make the scan pick them up. Pet scans are very sensitive, I have not had a full body MRI or bone scan yet. Monday I will have a bone scan though. so I am not sure how sensitive they are. My Onc at Dana Farber ordered a biopsy to confirm for future treatments and they were unable to get a sample due to "thick" bones. Sorry that your daughter is going through this. You have come to a good place. The women here are very supportive and knowledgeable. God bless your family

Posts.Content: Evans1128 wrote: I want to thank you ladies for the prayers and hugs. Just came from appt and got results from NP. I had scans done last week and was really hoping that everything was well considering I had not heard from them. I became worried that they would drop a bomb on me today and boy was I right. So here it is, the lesion on the iliac bone that was seen on PET did not show on the bone scan however the small spot in sacrum and lots of arthiritis was seen. CT shows a new node in the chest and spots on the lungs and liver. I am devastated right now and even told her that I didn't know if I wanted to go through with treatment. I just don't understand how I can go from bad to worse in the matter of 6 weeks. I'm starting to think that the chemo helped it spread instead of killing it. They are waiting for Dana Farber to see what the next line of treatment will be. All of this and we have to bury my cousin who just lost her battle on Friday. All I want to do is raise my son. He is turning one next month and I have been planning a sesame St extravaganza. Now I wonder if I will even be alive for the party. I don't know what to do. Heartbroken I will win this fight!!!! Dx 1/24/2012, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIIC, Grade 3, 3/8 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Chemotherapy 2/1/2012 Adriamycin (doxorubicin), Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Surgery 6/27/2012 Lymph node removal: Right, Sentinel; Mastectomy: Right Radiation Therapy 8/9/2012 Breast, Lymph nodes Chemotherapy Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Gemzar (gemcitabine) Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Feb 6, 2013 07:09PM Evans1128 wrote: Thank you so much ladies. I don't know what I would do without you all. I refuse to tell my family and friends, I called my mom and completely chickened out and didn't tell her about the lung and liver spots. I just couldn't stand to break her heart. She has been my best cheerleader and hopeful that I will beat this. At the same time I am sure she has done her homework so I know this will completely devastate her too. I'm so weak and drained right now. Emotionally and physically. NP said spots in lungs and liver are small and that I shouldn't have any symptoms from either. It does not soften the blow at all for me though. Just the thought of them being there is awful. I can't help but look at my boy and weep. What a mess I brought him into. I feel like such a bad mother.

Posts.Title: Bad scan. Need prayers Evans1128 Cafelovr

Posts.Content: Mar 1, 2013 07:48PM Evans1128 wrote: I have been thinking a lot about this lately. When I first met my Onc I felt really confident that she was going to fight with everything she had. After I gave birth and went into heart failure, I feel like doctors Became scared to touch me. I understood not having any more of the red devil but I still expected them to treat me aggressively. I had to ask for a scan before surgery and that's when the nodes in the chest were found. I think she is very intelligent and wants the best, however she seems to be overwhelmed. I'm really glad that she did refer me to Dana Farber. I have been sitting like a duck for the past month after finding spots on both liver and lungs. I am finally starting a clinical trial at Dana Farber. It took three weeks for them to get me an appt in Boston. I am really starting to freak out. Having more pains and feel like my liver is failing by the minute. I am so scared that they will refuse me treatment after a while although they keep telling me I have plenty of treatments to try. I just had a repeat CT at DF to qualify for the trial yesterday. I terrified to know the results. I feel like things have gotten worse while waiting. I am so sorry to rant on your post. This has been heavy on my mind. I don't know much about second opinions. My Onc referred me. Could you possibly ask yours if they recommend any place? Dana Farber is supposed to be good. Don't know if that is close to you. Whatever you decide I wish you the very best and pray that your next treatment kicks some butt!!!
